alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 13 at 8:19PM MST until November 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...QUICK BURST OF WINTER WEATHER TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... .A quick-hitting winter storm system will produce a burst of snow and wind with much colder temperatures tonight through Monday morning. Travel impacts are possible over parts of the area with areas of snow, strong winds, blowing snow, and reduced visibility. Wind chill values Monday morning will fall into the single digits. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches with locally higher amounts up to 9 inches atop mountain peaks. * WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 8 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-25 and U.S. 64 from Raton to Capulin. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
